block.p: Suzanne Andree Biallot and Peter Alan Siebert were married yesterday at St. Thomas Episcopal Church in New York. The Rev. Andrew Mead performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Siebert, a former beauty and health editor at Elle and Town & Country magazines, is the editorial director at a new health-care products company that Johnson & Johnson is developing in Fort Washington, Pa. She graduated from Briarcliff College.
Suzanne Andree Biallot and Peter Alan Siebert were married yesterday at St. Thomas Episcopal Church in New York. The Rev. Andrew Mead performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Siebert, a former beauty and health editor at Elle and Town & Country magazines, is the editorial director at a new health-care products company that Johnson & Johnson is developing in Fort Washington, Pa. She graduated from Briarcliff College.

The bride is the daughter of Marion Biallot of New York and the late Thomas Biallot. Her father owned Natural Extracts and Raw Materials Inc., a company in New York that manufactured and distributed oils used in perfume.

Mr. Siebert is the western regional vice president in Devon, Pa., for Nypro Inc., a custom injection molding company. He also owns the Jenard Company, a manufacturer of vinyl packaging in Yeadon, Pa. He graduated from Stanford University, from which he also received an M.B.A.

The bridegroom is a son of Dorothy and Robert J. Siebert of Amelia Island, Fla. The bridegroom's father, now retired, was the chief executive of CRC Chemicals, a former manufacturer of industrial maintenance chemicals in Warminster, Pa.
